paper_abstract: We present an incremental bounded model checking encoding into propositional satisfiability where the property specification is expressed as a weak alternating Buchi automaton (WABA). The encoding is linear in the specification, or, more exactly O(vertical bar I vertical bar + k (.) vertical bar T vertical bar + k (.) vertical bar delta vertical bar), where vertical bar I vertical bar is the size of the initial state predicate, k is the bound, vertical bar T vertical bar is the size of the transition relation, and 181 is the size of the WABA transition relation. Minimal length counterexamples can also be found by increasing the encoding size to be quadratic in the number of states in the largest component of the WABA. The proposed encoding can be used to implement more efficient bounded model checking algorithms for co-regular industrial specification languages such as Accellera's Property Specification Language (PSL). Encouraging experimental results on a prototype implementation are reported.
paper_title: Bounded model checking for weak alternating Buchi automata
